lead_paragraph: A soccer report in the Sports Briefing column on Tuesday about the resignation of Coach Ruud Gullit of the struggling Los Angeles Galaxy gave an outdated record for the team and for the number of appearances by its biggest star, David Beckham. At the time of the report, the team had won 6 of its first 19 games — not 9 of its first 30, which was its total for 2007. And Beckham had played in 18 games — not “only five games because of injuries,” which was also a statistic from last year.
